text: We will hear arguments next in Forsham against Harris.
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
What would be involvement, beyond finances or limited to finances and definition of the project?
No, Mr. Chief Justice, there are essentially -- we have set it out in our brief at pages 53 through 55, but essentially there are four major factors that show government involvement.
Let me back up a little bit.
To a certain extent, yes, Your Honor.
Well, what else is it besides a statutory construction case?
What has happened is that the lower courts have been evolving a series of standards because the statutory language does not speak directly to what constitutes agency records.
Then are you asking us to do anything except to construe a statute?
But you tell us very early in your brief that in this case, we cannot rely on the statutory language.
The statutory language in this particular case, Your Honor, is silent on what constitutes agency records.
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
